intro: Acrostichum borneense, commonly known as the Bornean holly fern, is a tropical plant native to the islands of Borneo. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery fronds with a distinctive, serrated margin. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its rhizomes are robust and help it spread through vegetative propagation. The fronds are evergreen, providing year-round foliage in its natural habitat.
